subject: Procedure for site visit/ inspection of works in DPR stage; on-going works and completed works.
text: HRd4 <e4 TTTHNf xifeaorut 7H9 / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 M1 (s6 Waev & {rTHrf 4Aq4) Ga Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vft-5 &a 6, #aer-10, GRGT, T fcrft-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Inspection of National Highways 2020 No18.55 Dated the 8th October, 2020 (Decision taken in File No: NHAIHO/QualityInspection/2020 (Computer No: 11162)) Sub: Procedure for site visit/ inspection of works in DPR stage, on-going works and completed works: Ref: MoRTH letter No. RW/NH-33044/32/2019-S&R (P&B) dated 18.03.2020. To ensure quality of National Highways works, need for frequent inspection by the officers of Authority was felt. Similar views were expressed by the MoRTH vide circular referred to above under reference Accordingly, it has been decided to have frequent inspections by the officers at various level as per the frequency mentioned in Annex-A. The inspection shall cover works in DPR stage, on-going works as well as completed works. The inspection report shall be prepared in the proforma enclosed at Annex-B and issued. Besides, the inspection report shall also be uploaded on Datalake. Inspecting officers are expected to carryout /witness some quality tests. 2 The report shall invariably cover status of resource mobilisation; reasons of slow progress, if any, construction  programme, EoT, deficiencies in executed works, site encumbrances, issues needing attention of the State, status of punch list items, requirement of change of scope both positive and negative, etc; Further, report shall also cover the quality of services being rendered by the DPR consultant Authority Engineer Independent Engineer /Safety Auditors etc. 3 Project Directors are expected to submit action taken report (ATR) on monthly basis and upload on Datalake: Inspecting officers may verify compliance of the earlier inspection report during the subsequent inspections. 4_ The following may be noted in this regard: The inspections/  inspection reports of officers of NHAI shall not   relieve   concessionaire/ contractor and IEIAE of their obligations under their contracts with NHAI; (ii) The subordinate officers in PIU, RO & HQ will issue their inspection reports with prior approval of PD, RO & CGM, HQ respectively; (iii) While issuing inspection reports, proper care should be taken by inspecting officers to protect the interest of NHAI and not to deviate from the contractual provisions/ rules/ guidelines. Mere mention in the inspection report does not mean that the proposal was approved. Prior approval of competent authority of NHAI, wherever required, shall be taken by PIU, RO & HQ: 5 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. Encl: As Above: Hiq4ak & (Digvijay Mishra) CGM (Coord) All Officers of NHAI HQ/RO/PIU/CMU M RT RT NHAI
